sentence.Network_en: He also warned of a possible anti-Western backlash.

sentence.Network_en: The government is facing an angry backlash from voters over the new tax.

sentence.Network_en: White backlash increases as the pressure for change in South Africa mounts.
sentence.Network_cn: 南非求变的压力升高,白人的敌意也加深.

entry.tran: 强烈反应；强烈抵制；激烈反对
entry.def: A backlash against a tendency or recent development in society or politics, is a sudden, strong reaction against it.

example.tran: 男性对女权运动的强烈抵制

means.word_mean: 1. a movement back from an impact
2. an adverse reaction to some political or social occurrence;
1. have an unexpected and undesired effect;

sentences.sentence: "Your comments may backfire and cause you a lot of trouble"
